LanguageData.GR_AgePillsTaken.description: Recovering from age pills. Age pills are hard on the body's metabolism, and it takes at least a day before other pill can take effect.
LanguageData.GR_AgePillsTaken.label: age pills
LanguageData.GR_ElectroEggHigh.description: Active mechanites in the bloodstream. They lift the mood and increase attentiveness.
LanguageData.GR_ElectroEggHigh.label: high on active mechanites
LanguageData.GR_ElectroEggTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to active mechanites. The more severe this tolerance is, the more active mechanites it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.GR_ElectroEggTolerance.label: active mechanites tolerance
LanguageData.GR_ElectroEggAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to active mechanites. Long-term presence of active mechanites has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without them. \nWithout regular doses of active mechanites, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.GR_ElectroEggAddiction.label: active mechanites addiction
LanguageData.GR_ElectroEggAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.GR_FeatherdustHigh.description: Featherdust's active chemical in the bloodstream. Generates a soft feeling of fuzzy well-being.
LanguageData.GR_FeatherdustHigh.label: stoned on featherdust
LanguageData.GR_FeatherdustTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to featherdust. The more severe this tolerance is, the more featherdust it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.GR_FeatherdustTolerance.label: featherdust tolerance
LanguageData.GR_FeatherdustAddiction.label: featherdust dependence
LanguageData.GR_FeatherdustAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to featherdust. Long-term use of featherdust has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of featherdust, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.GR_FeatherdustAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.GR_PoisonAmpouleDrank.label: poison ampoule
LanguageData.GR_PoisonAmpouleDrank.description: Poison in the bloodstream. Causes paralysis and wears off after a day.
LanguageData.GR_RoyalJellyHigh.label: royal jelly warmth
LanguageData.GR_RoyalJellyHigh.description: Royal Jelly chemicals in the bloodstream. It lifts the mood.
LanguageData.GR_RoyalJellyTolerance.label: royal jelly tolerance
LanguageData.GR_RoyalJellyTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to royal jelly. The more severe this tolerance is, the more royal jelly it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.GR_RoyalJellyAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to royal jelly. Long-term presence of royal jelly has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of royal jelly, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.GR_RoyalJellyAddiction.label: royal jelly addiction
LanguageData.GR_RoyalJellyAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
LanguageData.GR_VirulentPoisonDrank.label: virulent poison
LanguageData.GR_BearHybridGenes.label: bear genes (bear resilience)
LanguageData.GR_BearHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives a series of abilities related to bear resilience.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the ability to produce chemfuel like a boomalope.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeHybridGenes.label: boomalope genes (chemfuel production)
LanguageData.GR_CatHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the keen sight ability, increasing shooting accuracy.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_CatHybridGenes.label: cat genes (keen sight)
LanguageData.GR_ChickenHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the birdlike curiosity ability, increasing global learning speed.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenHybridGenes.label: chicken genes (birdlike curiosity)
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloHybridGenes.label: muffalo genes (wild attunement)
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the wild attunement ability, increasing plant work speed, carrying capacity, foraging and... leather amount.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_WolfHybridGenes.label: wolf genes (wolf speed)
LanguageData.GR_WolfHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the wolf speed ability, increasing movement speed, eating speed and immunity gain speed.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_RodentHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the gregarious ability, increasing all social abilities.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_RodentHybridGenes.label: rodent genes (gregarious)
LanguageData.GR_ReptileHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the cold blood ability, making the subject more stealthy and resistant to high temperatures.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_ReptileHybridGenes.label: reptile genes (cold blood)
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidHybridGenes.label: insectoid genes (eusocial mind)
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the eusocial mind ability, making the subject specialized in construction and repair at the expense of plant and animal skills.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the animal empathy ability, making the subject much more efficient when dealing with animals.\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboHybridGenes.label: thrumbo genes (animal affinity)
LanguageData.GR_MechanoidHybridGenes.description: This genetrainer gives the plasteel skin ability, making the subject immune to catching fire (bear in mind, fire explosions will still cause damage, but the subject will not catch fire).\n\nGenetrainers are implants that do not take the place of any given organ. Only one can be "installed" at a time. Using a second genetrainer will have no effect and the genetrainer will be wasted. Bear in mind that a genetrainer modifies the genes of the human subject, and only death will get rid of its effects.
LanguageData.GR_MechanoidHybridGenes.label: mechanoid genes (plasteel skin)
LanguageData.GR_RecentlyHatched.description: This creature has recently hatched from an incubator.
LanguageData.GR_RecentlyHatched.label: recently hatched
LanguageData.GR_AteChocolateEgg.description: This creature has recently eaten a chocolate egg.
LanguageData.GR_AteChocolateEgg.label: recently ate chocolate egg
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.description: Toxins in the bloodstream. This can come from various sources, including environmental toxins, venomous bites, or poisoned weapons. \nAt high doses, toxic buildup is lethal. Even at low doses, it can generate cancers. \nContrary to base game toxic buildup, creatures who die with toxic damage can be eaten.
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.label: toxic damage
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.stages.0.label: initial-hidden
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.stages.1.label: initial
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.stages.2.label: minor
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.stages.3.label: moderate
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.stages.4.label: serious
LanguageData.GR_ToxicDamage.stages.5.label: extreme
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.description: Genetically altered hairballs are suffocating this creature. This negatively affects breathing and can even cause unconsciousness.
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.label: hairball damage
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.stages.0.label: initial-hidden
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.stages.1.label: initial
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.stages.2.label: minor
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.stages.3.label: moderate
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.stages.4.label: serious
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.stages.5.label: extreme
LanguageData.GR_HairballDamage.stages.6.label: nauseating
LanguageData.GR_Kamikaze.label: sudden detonation
LanguageData.GR_Kamikaze.stages.0.label: initial-hidden
LanguageData.GR_Kamikaze.stages.1.label: critical
LanguageData.GR_AdrenalineBurst.label: adrenaline burst
LanguageData.GR_AdrenalineBurst.description: Adrenaline burst greatly increases the speed of the hybrid for a while, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_AdrenalineBurst.stages.1.label: exhausted
LanguageData.GR_Stamina.label: increased stamina
LanguageData.GR_Stamina.description: Increased stamina greatly increases the armor and pain resistance of the hybrid for a while, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_Stamina.stages.1.label: exhausted
LanguageData.GR_CatReflexes.label: cat reflexes
LanguageData.GR_CatReflexes.description: Cat reflexes greatly increases the speed and melee dodge chance of the hybrid for a while, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_CatReflexes.stages.1.label: exhausted
LanguageData.GR_KeenSenses.label: keen senses
LanguageData.GR_KeenSenses.description: Keen senses greatly increases sight and conciousness of the hybrid for a while, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_KeenSenses.stages.1.label: exhausted
LanguageData.GR_InsectClouds.label: releasing insect clouds
LanguageData.GR_InsectClouds.description: Releases insect clouds that damage anyone crossing through them, except insectoids, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_InsectClouds.stages.1.label: recovering
LanguageData.GR_Burrowing.label: burrowing underground
LanguageData.GR_Burrowing.description: Burrows underground to be able to move while being almost impervious to attacks. This ability needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_Burrowing.stages.1.label: recovering
LanguageData.GR_Stampeding.label: stampeding
LanguageData.GR_Stampeding.description: The stampeding ability increases the hybrid's speed and releases clouds of dust that block ranged visibility. Once used, this ability needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_Stampeding.stages.1.label: recovering
LanguageData.GR_CausedPoisonCloud.label: recently released poison cloud
LanguageData.GR_CausedPoisonCloud.description: Releases a poison cloud that harms anyone passing through it, except reptilians, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_CausedPoisonCloud.stages.0.label: recovering
LanguageData.GR_CausedHorror.label: recently invoked the insanity of That Which Man Is Not Meant to Know
LanguageData.GR_CausedHorror.description: Releases an insanity cloud that reduces sanity of anyone passing through it, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_CausedHorror.stages.0.label: recovering
LanguageData.GR_CausedPowerBeam.label: recently called an orbital power beam
LanguageData.GR_CausedPowerBeam.description: Calls a power beam from outer space, obliterating anything on its path, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_CausedPowerBeam.stages.0.label: recharging
LanguageData.GR_VentedExhaust.label: recently vented exhaust gasses
LanguageData.GR_VentedExhaust.description: Vents exhaust fumes on the 8 adjacent tiles, burning anyone unlucky enough to be in melee, and then it needs to be recharged to be used again.
LanguageData.GR_VentedExhaust.stages.0.label: recovering
LanguageData.GR_NoPain.label: no pain sensitivity
LanguageData.GR_NoPain.description: This hybrid has a reduced pain sensitivity, and it takes longer to be downed due to pain.
LanguageData.GR_MeleeDodge.label: melee dodging
LanguageData.GR_MeleeDodge.description: This hybrid is very agile and receives a considerable bonus to melee dodge.
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.description: This creature feeds on sunlight. Inadequate levels of light will kill it.
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.label: level of sunlight
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.stages.0.label: initial-hidden
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.stages.1.label: adequate light
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.stages.2.label: reasonable light levels
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.stages.3.label: poor light conditions
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.stages.4.label: lack of sunlight
LanguageData.GR_LightSustenance.stages.5.label: extreme lack of sustenance
LanguageData.GR_BearLeg.description: A prosthetic animal leg strengthened with bear muscles, and ending in a powerful bear claw that adds a powerful melee attack.
LanguageData.GR_BearLeg.label: animal Implant: bear leg (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_BearLeg.comps.0.tools.0.label: animal Implant: bear leg (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_LizardLeg.label: animal Implant: lizard leg (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_LizardLeg.description: A bionic animal leg reinforced with tough lizard skin.
LanguageData.GR_LizardLeg.comps.0.tools.0.label: animal Implant: lizard leg (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboLeg.label: animal Implant: thrumbo leg (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboLeg.description: A bionic animal leg reinforced with muscle tissue from a powerful thrumbo.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboLeg.comps.0.tools.0.label: animal Implant: thrumbo leg (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_ScytherTail.label: animal Implant: scyther tail (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_ScytherTail.description: A scyther tail created by attaching a scyther blade to an animal's tail. Note that only creatures with a natural tail can use this.
LanguageData.GR_ScytherTail.comps.0.tools.0.label: animal Implant: scyther tail (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_MechaTail.label: animal Implant: mechanoid tail (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_MechaTail.description: An advanced mechanoid tail, even more powerful than the old scyther tail. Note that only creatures with a natural tail can use this.
LanguageData.GR_MechaTail.comps.0.tools.0.label: animal Implant: mechanoid tail (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_CanidEye.label: animal Implant: canid eye (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_CanidEye.description: An eye implant that uses genetic splicing with canid genes to give an old (or damaged) eye decent vision. This implant is not meant to replace healthy eyes.
LanguageData.GR_InsectileEye.label: animal Implant: insectile eye (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_InsectileEye.description: A bionic implant which gives the creature compound insectile eyes. Compared with simple eyes, compound eyes possess a very large view angle, and can detect fast movement.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboEye.label: animal Implant: bionic thrumbo eye (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboEye.description: A bionic eye reinforced with specialized photoreceptors from a powerful thrumbo.
LanguageData.GR_RodentEar.label: animal Implant: rodent ear (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_RodentEar.description: An ear implant that uses genetic splicing with rodent genes to give an old (or damaged) ear decent hearing. This implant is not meant to replace healthy ears.
LanguageData.GR_MothTympanalOrgan.label: animal Implant: moth tympanal organ (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_MothTympanalOrgan.description: A bionic implant adding a moth tympanal organ to the creature's ear. Moths can hear sounds of a higher frequency than any bat can produce.
LanguageData.GR_MechaReceptors.label: animal Implant: mechanoid auditory receptors (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_MechaReceptors.description: These mechanoid auditory receptors can scan a really wide band of frequencies.
LanguageData.GR_RodentNose.label: animal Implant: rodent nose (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_RodentNose.description: An implant that uses genetic splicing with rodent genes to give an old (or damaged) nose decent smelling. This implant is not meant to replace healthy noses. Can't be installed on birds and insects.
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidPheromones.description: An implant that uses genetic splicing with alien insectoid genes to give the ability to detect pheromones, thus improving the olfactory system. Can't be installed on birds and (ironically) insects.
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidPheromones.label: animal Implant: insectoid pheromones (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_MiniatureThrumboHorn.description: A bionic implant adding a small thrumbo horn where the creature's nose used to be. This implant acts as a nose, allowing the creature to breathe and smell, and can be used by the creature in melee. Birds, insects, and creatures that already have a thrumbo horn don't have enough space on their skull to install this implant.
LanguageData.GR_MiniatureThrumboHorn.label: animal Implant: miniature thrumbo horn (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_WolfJaws.label: animal Implant: wolf jaws (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_WolfJaws.description: An implant that uses genetic splicing with wolf genes to give an old (or damaged) jaw decent functioning. This implant is not meant to replace healthy jaws.
LanguageData.GR_InsectMandibles.label: animal Implant: insect mandibles (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_InsectMandibles.description: A bionic implant adding insect mandibles to the creature's face. Insect mandibles improve manipulation and eating, while also working as an offesive weapon
LanguageData.GR_InsectMandibles.comps.0.tools.0.label: animal Implant: insect mandibles (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboJaws.label: animal Implant: bionic thrumbo jaws (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboJaws.description: A bionic implant adding thrumbo jaws to the creature's mouth. These creatures devour trees, so you can imagine their jaws are up to the task.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboJaws.comps.0.tools.0.label: animal Implant: bionic thrumbo jaws (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloSpine.label: animal Implant: muffalo spine (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloSpine.description: A spine implant that uses genetic splicing with muffalo genes to give an old (or damaged) spine decent functioning. This implant is not meant to replace healthy spines.
LanguageData.GR_CrocodileSpine.description: A bionic implant adding a sturdy crocodile spine to the creature's skeletal system.
LanguageData.GR_CrocodileSpine.label: animal Implant: crocodile spine (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_MechaSpine.description: A bionic implant adding a plasteel structure with active mechanites to the creature's skeletal system.
LanguageData.GR_MechaSpine.label: animal Implant: mechanoid spine (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_ChickenBrains.description: An implant that uses chicken brain tissue to patch damaged neurological pathways. This implant is intended for brain-dead creatures.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenBrains.label: animal Implant: chicken brains (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_MonitorLizardBrain.description: A bionic implant using monitor lizard brain tissue. This highly intelligent reptile has very quick reflexes.
LanguageData.GR_MonitorLizardBrain.label: animal Implant: monitor lizard brain (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboBrain.description: A bionic brain implant using thrumbo neural tissue. Superb intelligence and reflexes.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboBrain.label: animal Implant: bionic thrumbo brain (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeHeart.description: An implant that uses chemfuel to pump blood through the animal's body. This implant is intended for creatures whose heart is failing catastrophically, since it is less efficient than a natural heart.
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeHeart.label: animal Implant: boomalope heart (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_ChitinousHeart.description: A bionic heart implant using a reinforced shell of insectoid chitin for protection. This is a heart designed to take a beating. Pun intended, but it's the last one, I promise .
LanguageData.GR_ChitinousHeart.label: animal Implant: chitinous heart (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_MechaHeart.label: animal Implant: mechanoid heart (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_MechaHeart.description: A bionic heart strengthened by the action of active mechanites.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloLung.description: An implant that uses muffalo genes to increase breathing capacity.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloLung.label: animal Implant: muffalo lung (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_BearLiver.label: animal Implant: bear liver (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_BearLiver.description: An implant that uses bear genes to improve function of the liver. Specially useful for those alcoholic chickens.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenKidney.label: animal Implant: chicken kidney (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_ChickenKidney.description: An implant that uses chicken genes to improve function of the kidney. Birds have large kidneys. Yep, you learned that today.
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeStomach.label: animal Implant: boomalope stomach (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeStomach.description: An implant that uses boomalope genes to improve function of the stomach.
LanguageData.GR_BearClaws.description: An improvement over the bionic Power Claw, these claws have been vat-grown with a mixture of human and bear DNA, and replace the subject's hand with versatile, non-retractable claws.
LanguageData.GR_BearClaws.label: humanoid implant: bear claws
LanguageData.GR_BearClaws.comps.0.tools.0.label: bear claws
LanguageData.GR_DiggingBearClaws.description: Grotesque but powerful hand blades that have been modified to be used in mining operations, increasing both speed and yield.
LanguageData.GR_DiggingBearClaws.label: humanoid implant: digging bear claws
LanguageData.GR_BearMuscleTissue.description: Grafts of bear muscle tissue on the subject's torso increase overall strength and stamina. These grafts however tend to stimulate the production of an abundance of body hair.
LanguageData.GR_BearMuscleTissue.label: humanoid implant: bear muscle tissue
LanguageData.GR_HibernationModule.description: A biochip that modifies the brain to reduce the need for sleep.
LanguageData.GR_HibernationModule.label: humanoid implant: hibernation module
LanguageData.GR_Ovipositor.description: You know you have gone too far in your scientific experiments when you are implanting a human being with an ovipositor. This will enable the colonist to lay chicken eggs twice a day. It hurts as hell, though. Also, yuck.
LanguageData.GR_Ovipositor.label: humanoid implant: ovipositor
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloMammaries.description: By implanting muffalo mammaries into a colonist... Wait, what??? Who came up with this idea????? Anyway... this implant allows your colonist to be milked... Ugh, I give up.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloMammaries.label: humanoid implant: muffalo mammaries
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloMuscles.description: By weaving muffalo muscle strands with the subjects muscular system, strength, resilience and carrying capacity are greatly increased.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloMuscles.label: humanoid implant: muffalo strengthened muscles
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloSkin.description: A synthetic skin substitute that is much thicker and a much better insulator than human skin. This provides a measure of defense but, more importantly, makes the subject more resistant to low temperatures.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloSkin.label: humanoid implant: muffalo skin
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeNodules.description: These skin nodules can be integrated in a human's torso, causing a huge explosion if the subjects dies violently.
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeNodules.label: humanoid implant: boomalope nodules
LanguageData.GR_ChemfuelStomach.description: A reinforced bionic stomach that uses a combination of gastric acid and chemfuel to efficiently digest food.
LanguageData.GR_ChemfuelStomach.label: humanoid implant: chemfuel stomach
LanguageData.GR_ChemfuelHeart.description: A reinforced bionic heart that acts like a miniature 4-stroke internal combustion engine powered by chemfuel to pump blood through the body.
LanguageData.GR_ChemfuelHeart.label: humanoid implant: chemfuel heart
LanguageData.GR_WolfMuscularFibers.description: The subjects legs can be modified by weaving hybrid human/wolf muscle fibers within the base tissue, giving her a significant strength and speed boost.
LanguageData.GR_WolfMuscularFibers.label: humanoid implant: wolf muscular fibers
LanguageData.GR_DevouringJaws.description: A set of improved teeth designed to rapidly chew and ingest any kind of food. Leaves kind of a mess, though...
LanguageData.GR_DevouringJaws.label: humanoid implant: devouring jaws
LanguageData.GR_NeuronReinforcement.description: A biochip using animal stem cells to reinforce the natural abilities of human neurons, increasing learning and research speed.
LanguageData.GR_NeuronReinforcement.label: humanoid implant: neuron reinforcement
LanguageData.GR_MousePheromones.description: A bionic vomeronasal organ that allows the subject pheromonal communication with other animals, increasing the chance of taming and training them successfully.
LanguageData.GR_MousePheromones.label: humanoid implant: mouse pheromones
LanguageData.GR_MoleratNerveDampener.description: A biochip that reduces pain sensitivity, allowing the subject to survive pain shock.
LanguageData.GR_MoleratNerveDampener.label: humanoid implant: mole-rat nerve dampener
LanguageData.GR_BunnyEars.description: This huge leporid ear gives amazing enhanced hearing. Also, super kawaii!
LanguageData.GR_BunnyEars.label: humanoid implant: bunny ear
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidAntennae.description: These hybrid humanoid / insectoid feeling appendages can be implanted in a subject's head, completely modifying the way the subject "sees" and feels the surrounding world. The experience may be slightly overwhelming due to sensorial overload.
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidAntennae.label: humanoid implant: insectoid antennae
LanguageData.GR_CompoundEye.description: This hybrid humanoid / insectoid eye provides improved vision in a wide range of different wavelengths, including those usually outside the human range, completely modifying the way the subject perceives his surroundings.
LanguageData.GR_CompoundEye.label: humanoid implant: compound insectoid eye
LanguageData.GR_PsychicDampeners.description: Artificial hearing aids that block psychic emanations, providing considerable resistance to mechanoids' psychic attacks.
LanguageData.GR_PsychicDampeners.label: humanoid implant: psychic dampeners
LanguageData.GR_KidneyToxicFilters.description: This is a bioelectronic kidney prosthesis that greatly improves the efficiency of the subject's kidney by using insectoid tissue, providing resistence to toxic substances.
LanguageData.GR_KidneyToxicFilters.label: humanoid implant: kidney toxic filters
LanguageData.GR_HumanThrumboHorn.description: A genetically modified thrumbo horn that can be implanted in a subject's forehead. Nasty.
LanguageData.GR_HumanThrumboHorn.label: humanoid implant: thrumbo horn
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboSkin.description: A synthetic skin substitute that is much thicker and a much better insulator than human skin. This provides a lot of defense and makes the subject more resistant to extremes of temperature.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboSkin.label: humanoid implant: thrumbo skin
LanguageData.GR_VenomousFangs.description: This hybrid implant substitutes the subject's jaw with a set of venomous fangs. Useful in combat, but not very comfortable.
LanguageData.GR_VenomousFangs.label: humanoid implant: venomous fangs
LanguageData.GR_VenomousFangs.comps.0.tools.0.label: venomous fangs
LanguageData.GR_IguanaScales.description: A synthetic skin substitute that is much thicker and a much better insulator than human skin. This provides a measure of defense but, more importantly, makes the subject more resistant to high temperatures.
LanguageData.GR_IguanaScales.label: humanoid implant: iguana scales
LanguageData.GR_ChickenRimPox.label: rimpox
LanguageData.GR_ChickenRimPox.description: An infectious disease acting like a very powerful flu.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenRimPox.stages.0.label: minor
LanguageData.GR_ChickenRimPox.stages.1.label: major
LanguageData.GR_ChickenRimPox.stages.2.label: extreme
